## 0. How to Use This File (AI Operational Contract)

AI shall execute work in milestones. For each milestone, AI shall output:
- Files created/changed (paths).
- Commands to run locally (build/migrate/seed/start).
- Tests to run (unit/integration/e2e) and expected output.
- OpenAPI updates (if APIs changed).
- Any assumptions made (explicit list).

AI shall not ask vague questions. If information is missing, AI shall apply safest defaults and document assumptions under `ASSUMPTIONS` section.

Local baseline commands (example):
```bash
git clone <repo> urp
cd urp
cp .env.example .env
docker compose up -d
pnpm install
pnpm -r build
pnpm -C apps/backend prisma migrate dev
pnpm -C apps/backend seed
pnpm -C apps/backend dev
pnpm -C apps/frontend dev
```

## 1. Product Definition & Scope

### 1.1 One-line Product Statement
URP shall be a **multi-tenant, multi-asset** rental platform connecting **Landlords** and **Tenants**, providing end-to-end **Marketplace**, **Property Ops**, and **Finance** (billing, payments, escrow/deposit, append-only ledger) with **config-based extensibility** (“rộng vô hạn”) without hard-coded asset types.

### 1.2 Three Pillars (MUST)
- **Marketplace**: listings, media, search/discovery, lead/inquiry, booking/holds.
- **Property Ops**: asset registry + asset graph (space nodes), agreement engine (state machine), availability engine (exclusive/capacity/slot), tickets/maintenance, check-in/out, inspections.
- **Finance**: pricing policy engine, billing & invoicing, payments, escrow/deposit, ledger (append-only), reconciliation, disputes/refunds/chargebacks.

### 1.3 Supported Asset Universe (MUST)
System shall support **all rentable real-estate-related assets**, including but not limited to:
- Apartment/house/villa/condo (monthly/weekly)
- Room/bed/dormitory (exclusive or shared capacity)
- Homestay/hotel room (nightly)
- Coworking/meeting room (hourly slot booking)
- Parking slot/garage (slot/time)
- Warehouse/storage unit (capacity-based)
- Retail kiosk/booth, billboard/OOH inventory (slot/time)
- Land lease (term-based)

### 1.4 Out of Scope (Now)
- IoT/hardware device control (locks, sensors).
- Blockchain-based ownership/ledger.
- Native mobile apps (unless explicitly planned later).

---

## 2. Non-negotiable Constraints (MUST)

C-001. System shall not hard-code asset types. All asset-specific fields shall be defined via Config Engine (versioned config bundles).
C-002. Ledger shall be **append-only**. No update/delete operations are permitted on ledger entries.
C-003. Multi-tenant isolation shall be enforced at API, DB, cache, logs, and storage layers.
C-004. All finance mutations (invoice/payment/ledger) shall be idempotent using idempotency keys.
C-005. RBAC shall be deny-by-default; data scoping shall be enforced for every read/write.
C-006. Every mutation shall produce audit logs (actor_id, org_id, resource_id, request_id, timestamp).
C-007. Public endpoints shall have rate limiting + anti-abuse controls.
C-008. Webhooks shall be signature-verified and replay-safe.
C-009. PII shall be masked in logs; secrets shall not be committed.

## 3. Target Architecture & Tech Stack

### 3.1 Chosen Stack (LOCKED for implementation)
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS)** + **TypeScript** + **Prisma**
- Database: **PostgreSQL** (primary), optional **PostGIS** for geo search
- Cache: **Redis**
- Queue: **BullMQ** (Redis-backed)
- Search: Postgres full-text + trigram + geo index (Phase 1). Optional Elasticsearch (Phase 2).
- Storage: S3-compatible (MinIO local, AWS S3 prod)
- Frontend: **React + Vite + TypeScript + Tailwind**
- Auth: JWT (access+refresh)
- Observability: Prometheus/Grafana + OpenTelemetry (Phase 2)

### 3.2 Deployment Model
Phase 1 shall use **modular monolith** (single backend app with strict module boundaries).
Phase 2 may split into microservices (Marketplace/Ops/Finance) behind an API gateway.

## 4. Core Domain Model (Entities, Relationships, Invariants)

### 4.1 Entity Catalog
Entities shall be implemented with strict tenant isolation and auditable lifecycle metadata (`created_at`, `updated_at`, `created_by`, `updated_by`, `org_id`).

| Entity | Purpose |
|---|---|
| **Organization** | Tenant boundary. Holds config bundles, users, assets, finance settings. |
| **User** | Authenticated identity. Belongs to Organization; may represent a Party. |
| **Party** | Business actor (Tenant/Landlord/Manager). One Party may map to one or more Users. |
| **Asset** | Top-level real-estate asset: building, house, land, warehouse, coworking facility. |
| **SpaceNode** | Node in asset graph (tree/graph): building→floor→unit→room→bed/slot. |
| **RentableItem** | Bookable/rentable unit with allocation_type (exclusive/capacity/slot). |
| **Listing** | Marketplace representation of one or more RentableItems with pricing/display. |
| **Lead** | Inquiry/interest record initiated by Tenant or captured by Landlord. |
| **AvailabilityHold** | Temporary hold to prevent double booking; expires. |
| **Booking** | Reservation for a time range or slot; may create Agreement. |
| **Agreement** | Contract/lease; governed by state machine; binds Parties and RentableItems. |
| **PricingPolicy** | Config-based rules: base rate, seasonality, promotions, fees, discounts. |
| **Invoice** | Bill for Agreement period; includes line items; has payment status. |
| **Payment** | Payment attempt/transaction; reconciled by webhook; idempotent. |
| **EscrowDeposit** | Deposit/escrow tracking with release rules. |
| **LedgerEntry** | Append-only financial ledger entries for reconciliation. |
| **Ticket** | Maintenance/support ticket with attachments and workflow. |
| **Notification** | Email/SMS/in-app notifications; queued and retryable. |
| **AuditLog** | Immutable audit record of mutations and security events. |
| **ConfigBundle** | Versioned config set defining schemas, workflows, pricing, validations. |

### 4.2 Key Relationships (ER Summary)
- Organization 1—N Users / Parties / Assets / ConfigBundles / LedgerEntries.
- Asset 1—N SpaceNodes; SpaceNode 1—N RentableItems.
- Listing N—N RentableItems (via join table) to allow multi-unit listings.
- Agreement binds: Parties (Landlord/Tenant), RentableItem(s), and generates Invoices.
- Payment relates to Invoice; LedgerEntry references Payment/Invoice for auditability.

### 4.3 Invariants (MUST)
INV-001. Every entity row shall include `org_id` and all queries shall filter by `org_id` (tenant isolation).
INV-002. LedgerEntry shall be append-only; no UPDATE/DELETE endpoints/SQL statements are allowed.
INV-003. RentableItem uniqueness: `org_id + rentable_item_id` shall be globally unique; within one SpaceNode, `code` shall be unique.
INV-004. Booking conflicts shall be prevented by Availability Engine per allocation_type:
- exclusive: no overlapping bookings.
- capacity: sum(booking.qty) shall not exceed capacity.
- slot: bookings shall match slot boundaries and not overlap for same slot key.
INV-005. Payment processing shall be idempotent by `(org_id, idempotency_key, invoice_id)`.
INV-006. Agreement state transitions shall be validated by role + conditions; invalid transitions return 409.
INV-007. Webhook replay shall not duplicate Payment/LedgerEntry; system shall use provider_event_id for dedup.

## 5. Database Design (PostgreSQL) — Minimal Actionable DDL

This section provides **copy-paste-ready** baseline DDL. Prisma schema shall reflect equivalent constraints.

```sql
-- NOTE: This is baseline DDL (not exhaustive). Use Prisma migrations in real implementation.

CREATE TABLE organizations (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'ACTIVE',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE TABLE users (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  email TEXT NOT NULL,
  password_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
  status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'ACTIVE',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  UNIQUE(org_id, email)
);

CREATE TABLE assets (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  asset_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- defined by ConfigBundle
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  address_json JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
  geo GEOGRAPHY(POINT, 4326),
  status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'ACTIVE',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE INDEX assets_geo_idx ON assets USING GIST (geo);
CREATE INDEX assets_org_idx ON assets (org_id);

CREATE TABLE space_nodes (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  asset_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES assets(id),
  parent_id UUID NULL REFERENCES space_nodes(id),
  node_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- building/floor/unit/room/bed/slot...
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  path TEXT NOT NULL, -- materialized path e.g. /b1/f2/u203
  attrs JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}', -- custom fields
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE INDEX space_nodes_asset_idx ON space_nodes (org_id, asset_id);
CREATE INDEX space_nodes_path_idx ON space_nodes (org_id, path);

CREATE TABLE rentable_items (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  space_node_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES space_nodes(id),
  code TEXT NOT NULL,
  allocation_type TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (allocation_type IN ('exclusive','capacity','slot')),
  capacity INT NULL, -- for capacity type
  slot_config JSONB NULL, -- for slot type
  status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'ACTIVE',
  attrs JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  UNIQUE(org_id, space_node_id, code)
);

CREATE TABLE agreements (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  landlord_party_id UUID NOT NULL,
  tenant_party_id UUID NOT NULL,
  state TEXT NOT NULL, -- draft/review/signed/active/suspended/terminated/expired
  agreement_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- lease/booking
  start_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL,
  end_at TIMESTAMPTZ NULL,
  terms_json JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE INDEX agreements_org_state_idx ON agreements (org_id, state);

CREATE TABLE invoices (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  agreement_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES agreements(id),
  period_start DATE NOT NULL,
  period_end DATE NOT NULL,
  currency TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'VND',
  total_amount BIGINT NOT NULL CHECK (total_amount >= 0),
  status TEXT NOT NULL, -- ISSUED/PAID/VOID/OVERDUE
  line_items JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '[]',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE TABLE payments (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  invoice_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES invoices(id),
  provider TEXT NOT NULL, -- vnpay/momo/stripe
  amount BIGINT NOT NULL,
  currency TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'VND',
  status TEXT NOT NULL, -- PENDING/SUCCEEDED/FAILED/REFUNDED
  idempotency_key TEXT NOT NULL,
  provider_event_id TEXT NULL,
  raw_json JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(),
  UNIQUE(org_id, invoice_id, idempotency_key)
);

CREATE TABLE ledger_entries (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  org_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id),
  entry_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- INVOICE_ISSUED/PAYMENT_SUCCEEDED/REFUND/CHARGEBACK...
  ref_type TEXT NOT NULL,  -- Invoice/Payment/Agreement...
  ref_id UUID NOT NULL,
  amount BIGINT NOT NULL,
  currency TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'VND',
  direction TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (direction IN ('debit','credit')),
  occurred_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL,
  metadata JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE INDEX ledger_org_occ_idx ON ledger_entries (org_id, occurred_at);
```

## 6. Security Model — RBAC & Data Scope

### 6.1 Permission Conventions
- Entities: Asset, SpaceNode, RentableItem, Listing, Lead, Booking, Agreement, Invoice, Payment, LedgerEntry, Ticket, ConfigBundle, User, RolePolicy.
- Actions: create, read, update, delete, approve, activate, pay, reconcile, export.
- Scope: org-level + assigned assets + own records (tenant).

### 6.2 RBAC Matrix (Minimum Safe Permissions)
| Role \ Entity | Listing | Search | Lead | Booking | Asset | SpaceNode | RentableItem | Agreement | Invoice | Payment | LedgerEntry | Ticket | ConfigBundle | UserMgmt | AuditLog |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| **Tenant** | R (public) | R (public) | C,R,U (own) | C,R,U (own) | R (own) | R (own) | R (own) | C,R,U (own) | C,R,U (own) | C,R (own) | R (own derived) | C,R,U (own) | R (own) | R (own) | R (own) |
| **Landlord** | C,R,U (org/assigned) | R (public+org) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | R (org) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | C,R (org) | R (org) | C,R,U (org/assigned) | R (org) | R (org) | C,R,U (org/assigned) |
| **PropertyManager** | R (assigned/org) | R (assigned/org) | R,U (assigned) | R,U (assigned) | R,U (assigned) | R,U (assigned) | R,U (assigned) | R,U (assigned) | R (assigned/org) | R (assigned/org) | R (assigned/org) | R,U (assigned) | R (assigned/org) | R (assigned/org) | R (assigned/org) |
| **OrgAdmin** | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U (org) | R,Export (org) | C,R,U (org) | C,R,U,Export (org) | C,R,U,Export (org) | C,R,U,Export (org) |
| **PlatformAdmin** | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) | ALL (global) |

### 6.3 JWT Claims (MUST)
```json
{
  "sub": "user_uuid",
  "org_id": "org_uuid",
  "role": "Tenant|Landlord|PropertyManager|OrgAdmin|PlatformAdmin",
  "scopes": [
    "assets:read",
    "agreements:write"
  ],
  "assigned_asset_ids": [
    "asset_uuid_1",
    "asset_uuid_2"
  ],
  "iat": 0,
  "exp": 0,
  "jti": "token_id"
}
```

### 6.4 Security Requirements (NFR subset)
- SEC-001 System shall enforce TLS for all external traffic.
- SEC-002 System shall validate all inputs with schema validation and return structured errors.
- SEC-003 System shall implement rate limiting for public endpoints (search/listing view) and auth endpoints.
- SEC-004 System shall store secrets only in secret manager (local: .env, prod: AWS Secrets Manager/K8s Secrets).
- SEC-005 System shall mask PII in logs and not log payment full PAN/credentials.

## 7. API Specification (Contract-First)

### 7.1 Global API Conventions
- Base URL: `/api/v1`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Pagination: `page`, `page_size`, `sort`, `order`
- Error response format (MUST):
```json
{
  "error_code": "VALIDATION_ERROR",
  "message": "field required",
  "details": [
    {
      "path": "price",
      "reason": "required"
    }
  ],
  "request_id": "req_abc123"
}
```
- Request id header: `X-Request-Id` (generated if missing).
- Idempotency header: `Idempotency-Key` for finance mutations (payments, refunds).

### 7.2 Error Codes (Canonical)
| error_code | HTTP | Meaning |
|---|---:|---|
| VALIDATION_ERROR | 400 | Input invalid; details contain field paths |
| UNAUTHORIZED | 401 | Missing/invalid token |
| FORBIDDEN_SCOPE | 403 | RBAC/data scope denies access |
| NOT_FOUND | 404 | Resource not found in org scope |
| CONFLICT | 409 | State conflict (booking overlap / invalid transition) |
| RATE_LIMITED | 429 | Too many requests |
| PROVIDER_ERROR | 502 | Payment provider or external integration failure |
| INTERNAL_ERROR | 500 | Unhandled error |

## 9. Key Algorithms & Edge Cases

### 9.1 Availability Engine (exclusive/capacity/slot)
Availability Engine shall prevent conflicts according to `allocation_type` and shall support temporary holds.

#### 9.1.1 Pseudocode — Exclusive
```python
def can_book_exclusive(existing_bookings, req_from, req_to):
    # existing_bookings: list of (from,to,status)
    for b in existing_bookings:
        if b.status in ("CONFIRMED","ACTIVE","HOLD") and overlaps(b.from, b.to, req_from, req_to):
            return False
    return True
```

#### 9.1.2 Pseudocode — Capacity
```python
def can_book_capacity(existing_bookings, req_from, req_to, req_qty, capacity):
    used = 0
    for b in existing_bookings:
        if b.status in ("CONFIRMED","ACTIVE","HOLD") and overlaps(b.from,b.to,req_from,req_to):
            used += b.qty
    return (used + req_qty) <= capacity
```

#### 9.1.3 Pseudocode — Slot
```python
def can_book_slot(existing, slot_key):
    # slot_key: e.g. '2026-01-04T09:00+07:00/60m/roomA'
    return slot_key not in {b.slot_key for b in existing if b.status in ("CONFIRMED","HOLD")}
```

### 9.2 Agreement State Machine (MUST)
- States: draft → review → signed → active → (suspended ↔ active) → terminated/expired
- Invalid transitions shall return 409 `CONFLICT` with `error_code=INVALID_TRANSITION`.

### 9.3 Finance Idempotency (MUST)
- Payment creation shall require `Idempotency-Key`.
- Webhook handler shall deduplicate by provider_event_id and `(invoice_id, idempotency_key)`.
- LedgerEntry creation shall be guarded by unique constraint on `(org_id, entry_type, ref_type, ref_id, occurred_at_bucket)` or equivalent.

## 11. Test Plan — Execution-Ready

### 11.1 Test Levels
- Unit tests: validators, services, state machines, pricing/availability algorithms.
- Integration tests: API + DB + Redis + queue; payment webhook signature verification; idempotency.
- E2E tests: user journeys (tenant search→booking→agreement→invoice→payment).
- Security tests: OWASP checks, auth, RBAC boundary tests, rate limiting.
- Performance tests: search latency, invoice generation throughput.

### 11.2 Entry/Exit Criteria
- Entry: code freeze for milestone; migrations finalized; staging env available.
- Exit: 0 critical defects; all tests passing; coverage thresholds met; perf targets met.

### 11.3 Test Data
- Seed 1000 listings across 10 asset types; 200 agreements; 400 invoices; 500 payments; 300 tickets.
- Data shall be anonymized; no real PII in staging datasets.

## 12. Deployment Guide (Step-by-step)

### 12.1 Environments
- Local dev: Docker Compose (Postgres, Redis, MinIO) + pnpm dev servers.
- Staging: Kubernetes namespace `urp-staging` with managed DB/Redis.
- Production: Kubernetes namespace `urp-prod` with HPA, blue/green or rolling updates.

### 12.2 Prerequisites Checklist
- Docker 20+
- Node.js 18+
- pnpm
- kubectl + helm (for staging/prod)
- Access to secrets manager (AWS)

### 12.3 Local Deployment (Expected Outputs included)
```bash
cp .env.example .env
docker compose up -d
pnpm install
pnpm -r build
pnpm -C apps/backend prisma migrate dev
pnpm -C apps/backend seed
pnpm -C apps/backend dev
# Expected: API listening at http://localhost:3000/api/v1 and /healthz returns 200
```

### 12.4 Staging Deployment (K8s)
Deployment shall be Helm-based with versioned image tags and mandatory post-deploy smoke tests.
```bash
kubectl create namespace urp-staging || true
helm upgrade --install urp ./infra/helm/urp -n urp-staging --set image.tag=v1.0.0
kubectl -n urp-staging get pods
# Expected: all pods Running/Ready
```

### 12.5 Post-Deployment Verification
- Smoke: `GET /healthz` returns 200.
- Auth: login works and returns JWT.
- RBAC: tenant cannot access landlord-only endpoints.
- Finance: create invoice → pay → webhook → ledger entry appended.

### 12.6 Rollback
```bash
kubectl -n urp-prod rollout undo deploy/urp-backend
kubectl -n urp-prod rollout status deploy/urp-backend
```

## 13. CI/CD (GitHub Actions)

Pipeline shall run build, lint, tests, and publish docker images on main.
```yaml
name: urp-ci
on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
jobs:
  build_test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with: { version: 9 }
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with: { node-version: 18, cache: 'pnpm' }
      - run: pnpm install
      - run: pnpm -r lint
      - run: pnpm -r test
      - run: pnpm -r build

```

## 14. Observability & KPIs

### 14.1 Required Metrics
- API latency (p50/p95/p99) per route group
- Error rate per route + error_code
- Search query count + cache hit ratio
- Agreement lifecycle counts per state
- Invoice issued/paid/overdue counts
- Payment success rate + provider errors
- Ledger append rate + reconciliation drift

### 14.2 Logging Standard (MUST)
All logs shall be JSON structured with fields: `timestamp`, `level`, `request_id`, `org_id`, `user_id`, `route`, `status`, `error_code`.
```json
{
  "timestamp": "2026-01-04T10:00:00+07:00",
  "level": "INFO",
  "request_id": "req_abc",
  "org_id": "org_123",
  "user_id": "usr_456",
  "route": "GET /api/v1/search/listings",
  "status": 200,
  "duration_ms": 123
}
```

## 15. Implementation Milestones (AI shall follow)

### M1 Foundation
- Scaffold repo, env, docker-compose, DB migrations baseline.
- Implement Auth (login/refresh) + JWT + request_id middleware.
- Implement RBAC engine + data scope guards (deny-by-default).
- Implement Config Engine skeleton: create/list/activate bundles.
- Implement Audit logs for all mutations.
- Deliver OpenAPI skeleton + CI pipeline baseline.

### M2 Marketplace
- Listing CRUD + publish/unpublish + media refs.
- Search endpoints: filters, pagination, geo, suggest.
- Lead/inquiry flow + conversion stub to booking/agreement.
- Frontend pages: listing list/detail, search results, lead form.
- Tests: API contract + E2E search→lead.

### M3 Property Ops
- Asset registry + SpaceNode graph CRUD + RentableItem CRUD.
- Availability Engine + holds + booking conflict prevention.
- Agreement Engine state machine + transitions + permissions.
- Frontend: landlord console for assets, agreements, bookings.
- Tests: conflict edge cases, transition invalid cases.

### M4 Finance
- Pricing policies (config-driven).
- Invoice generator (cycle, prorate, late fee).
- Payment intent + provider abstraction + webhook handler (signature + replay-safe).
- Ledger append-only + reconciliation report.
- Tests: idempotency, webhook replay, double charge prevention.

### M5 Tenant Journey + Ops
- Tenant portal: agreements, invoices, pay, tickets.
- Maintenance tickets: attachments, assignment, SLA statuses.
- Notifications: queued email/sms/in-app (mock providers).
- Reports dashboards (basic).

### M6 Hardening
- Performance tests (search benchmark).
- Security review: OWASP checklist, rate limiting, PII masking verification.
- CI/CD deploy staging + smoke tests + rollback docs.
- Docs updates and final QA sign-off.

```bash
curl 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/search/listings?q=studio&city=Hanoi&page=1&page_size=20'
```

```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/payments \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -H 'Idempotency-Key: idem_001' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"invoice_id":"<uuid>","provider":"vnpay"}'
```
